segment.source: You can customize the Push-button reset experience by configuring extensibility points.
segment.target: You can customize the Push-button reset experience by configuring extensibility points.

segment.source: This enables you to run custom scripts, install additional applications, or preserve additional user or application data.
segment.target: This enables you to run custom scripts, install additional applications, or preserve additional user or application data.

segment.source: Add a script to push-button reset features
segment.target: Add a script to push-button reset features

segment.source: Add a script to push-button reset features
segment.target: Add a script to push-button reset features

segment.source: You can customize the Push-button reset experience by configuring extensibility points.
segment.target: You can customize the Push-button reset experience by configuring extensibility points.

segment.source: This enables you to run custom scripts, install additional applications, or preserve additional user or application data.
segment.target: This enables you to run custom scripts, install additional applications, or preserve additional user or application data.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: To configure extensibility points and customize the Push-button reset experience, you need the following.
segment.target: To configure extensibility points and customize the Push-button reset experience, you need the following.

segment.source: A configuration file named ResetConfig.xml
segment.target: A configuration file named ResetConfig.xml

segment.source: Scripts that execute custom operations at selected extensibility points.
segment.target: Scripts that execute custom operations at selected extensibility points.

segment.source: Any additional files required by the scripts
segment.target: Any additional files required by the scripts

segment.source: Each script must meet the following requirements:
segment.target: Each script must meet the following requirements:

segment.source: Be an executable (.exe) or a command script (.cmd)
segment.target: Be an executable (.exe) or a command script (.cmd)

segment.source: Run without displaying a graphical user interface (GUI)
segment.target: Run without displaying a graphical user interface (GUI)

segment.source: Return either 0 to indicate a successful operation, or a non-zero value to indicate an unsuccessful operation
segment.target: Return either 0 to indicate a successful operation, or a non-zero value to indicate an unsuccessful operation

segment.source: These files should be placed in the folder C:RecoveryOEM, and will automatically be detected by Push-button reset features.
segment.target: These files should be placed in the folder C:RecoveryOEM, and will automatically be detected by Push-button reset features.

segment.source: It's OK to use subfolders.
segment.target: It's OK to use subfolders.

segment.source: Step 1: Creating Configuration Files to Prepare for Recovery
segment.target: Step 1: Creating Configuration Files to Prepare for Recovery

segment.source: To create extensibility scripts
segment.target: To create extensibility scripts

segment.source: In Notepad, you can create custom scripts to save or retrieve log files, check partitions, and to install applications.
segment.target: In Notepad, you can create custom scripts to save or retrieve log files, check partitions, and to install applications.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Your scripts must meet the following requirements:
segment.target: Your scripts must meet the following requirements:

segment.source: The scripts are formatted as a .cmd or .exe files.
segment.target: The scripts are formatted as a .cmd or .exe files.

segment.source: The scripts do not depend on Windows PE optional components not present in the default Windows RE image (winre.wim).
segment.target: The scripts do not depend on Windows PE optional components not present in the default Windows RE image (winre.wim).

segment.source: The scripts do not depend on binaries (e.g. .exe or .dll files) not present in the default Windows RE image (winre.wim).
segment.target: The scripts do not depend on binaries (e.g. .exe or .dll files) not present in the default Windows RE image (winre.wim).

segment.source: The scripts run without displaying a graphical user interface (GUI).
segment.target: The scripts run without displaying a graphical user interface (GUI).

segment.source: The scripts complete all intended functions within 5 minutes for each extensibility point.
segment.target: The scripts complete all intended functions within 5 minutes for each extensibility point.

segment.source: The script must not modify the drive letters.
segment.target: The script must not modify the drive letters.

segment.source: This can potentially cause the recovery to fail.
segment.target: This can potentially cause the recovery to fail.

segment.source: Your scripts must return a 0 (zero), if successful.
segment.target: Your scripts must return a 0 (zero), if successful.

segment.source: If push-button reset receives a non-0 value, the following steps occur:
segment.target: If push-button reset receives a non-0 value, the following steps occur:

segment.source: If running the Refresh your PC feature: All system changes are rolled back.
segment.target: If running the Refresh your PC feature: All system changes are rolled back.

segment.source: If the script or executable file is initiated from the Windows PC settings menu, the system reboots in Windows.
segment.target: If the script or executable file is initiated from the Windows PC settings menu, the system reboots in Windows.

segment.source: If the script or executable file is initiated from Windows RE or the Boot Options menu, the system remains in Windows RE and displays an error message.
segment.target: If the script or executable file is initiated from Windows RE or the Boot Options menu, the system remains in Windows RE and displays an error message.

segment.source: If running the Reset your PC feature: The failure is ignored.
segment.target: If running the Reset your PC feature: The failure is ignored.

segment.source: The script or executable file proceeds to the next step in the reset process and logs the failure.
segment.target: The script or executable file proceeds to the next step in the reset process and logs the failure.

segment.source: You can use the following locations for storage, if needed.
segment.target: You can use the following locations for storage, if needed.

segment.source: Windows PE RAM drive (X:).
segment.target: Windows PE RAM drive (X:).

segment.source: This virtual drive is created by Windows PE, and stays active during the Refresh your PC process.
segment.target: This virtual drive is created by Windows PE, and stays active during the Refresh your PC process.

segment.source: You can use it with the Refresh your PC feature to save data before the partition is refreshed, and to restore the data after the partition refresh is complete.
segment.target: You can use it with the Refresh your PC feature to save data before the partition is refreshed, and to restore the data after the partition refresh is complete.

segment.source: The amount of available memory is limited to the amount of RAM on the system, minus the amount of RAM needed for the Windows RE tools when fully expanded.
segment.target: The amount of available memory is limited to the amount of RAM on the system, minus the amount of RAM needed for the Windows RE tools when fully expanded.

segment.source: For instructions about mounting Windows RE and determining the fully-expanded file size, see Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: For instructions about mounting Windows RE and determining the fully-expanded file size, see Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: Designated OEM partition.
segment.target: Designated OEM partition.

segment.source: You can leave extra room on a partition.
segment.target: You can leave extra room on a partition.

segment.source: For example, you can leave room on the recovery image partition, and use scripts to temporarily assign a drive letter and then save files to that partition.
segment.target: For example, you can leave room on the recovery image partition, and use scripts to temporarily assign a drive letter and then save files to that partition.

segment.source: However, if your user uses the recovery media to repartition the disks, the data on these partitions might be lost during the recovery process.
segment.target: However, if your user uses the recovery media to repartition the disks, the data on these partitions might be lost during the recovery process.

segment.source: Example 1: Saving Log Files
segment.target: Example 1: Saving Log Files

segment.source: This example script preserves files that would otherwise be removed, by placing them in a temporary location in memory, to be retrieved by another sample script, RetrieveLogFiles.cmd.
segment.target: This example script preserves files that would otherwise be removed, by placing them in a temporary location in memory, to be retrieved by another sample script, RetrieveLogFiles.cmd.

segment.source: Example 2: Retrieving Log Files
segment.target: Example 2: Retrieving Log Files

segment.source: This sample script retrieves the files that were saved in memory by the script, and adds them back to the system.
segment.target: This sample script retrieves the files that were saved in memory by the script, and adds them back to the system.

segment.source: It also runs a system diagnostic, and then sends the output to the C:Fabrikam folder.
segment.target: It also runs a system diagnostic, and then sends the output to the C:Fabrikam folder.

segment.source: To create a push-button reset configuration file
segment.target: To create a push-button reset configuration file

segment.source: In Notepad, create a configuration file (ResetConfig.xml) that points to your push-button reset extensibility scripts.
segment.target: In Notepad, create a configuration file (ResetConfig.xml) that points to your push-button reset extensibility scripts.

segment.source: For more information about this file, see ResetConfig XML Reference.
segment.target: For more information about this file, see ResetConfig XML Reference.

segment.source: Where SaveLogFiles.cmd, RetrieveLogFiles.cmd, CheckPartitions.exe, and InstallApps.cmd are all fictional scripts.
segment.target: Where SaveLogFiles.cmd, RetrieveLogFiles.cmd, CheckPartitions.exe, and InstallApps.cmd are all fictional scripts.

segment.source: Click File, and then click Save As.
segment.target: Click File, and then click Save As.

segment.source: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as E:RecoveryRecoveryImageResetConfig.xml.
segment.target: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as E:RecoveryRecoveryImageResetConfig.xml.

segment.source: Where E is the drive letter of a USB flash drive or other removable media.
segment.target: Where E is the drive letter of a USB flash drive or other removable media.

segment.source: Do not use ANSI coding.
segment.target: Do not use ANSI coding.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can use the same ResetConfig.xml file to configure Windows to create recovery media.
segment.target: You can use the same ResetConfig.xml file to configure Windows to create recovery media.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy Push-Button Reset Features.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy Push-Button Reset Features.

segment.source: Step 2: Adding Configuration Files and Scripts to the Destination Computer
segment.target: Step 2: Adding Configuration Files and Scripts to the Destination Computer

segment.source: To add your configuration files and scripts
segment.target: To add your configuration files and scripts

segment.source: On your destination computer, insert the USB flash drive with the configuration files.
segment.target: On your destination computer, insert the USB flash drive with the configuration files.

segment.source: Copy the configuration files to the destination computer
segment.target: Copy the configuration files to the destination computer

segment.source: where E is the drive letter of the USB flash drive.
segment.target: where E is the drive letter of the USB flash drive.

segment.source: Sample script: making sure unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, and OOBE.xml are kept during a reset
segment.target: Sample script: making sure unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, and OOBE.xml are kept during a reset

segment.source: Windows doesn't automatically save settings created through unattend.xml setup files, nor Windows Start Menu customizations created with LayoutModification.xml during a full-system reset, nor first-login info from oobe.xml.
segment.target: Windows doesn't automatically save settings created through unattend.xml setup files, nor Windows Start Menu customizations created with LayoutModification.xml during a full-system reset, nor first-login info from oobe.xml.

segment.source: To make sure your customizations are saved, that includes steps to put the unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, and oobe.xml files back into place.
segment.target: To make sure your customizations are saved, that includes steps to put the unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, and oobe.xml files back into place.

segment.source: Here's some sample scripts that show how to retain these settings and put them back into the right spots.
segment.target: Here's some sample scripts that show how to retain these settings and put them back into the right spots.

segment.source: Save copies of unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, oobe.xml, plus these two text files, in C:RecoveryOEM.
segment.target: Save copies of unattend.xml, LayoutModification.xml, oobe.xml, plus these two text files, in C:RecoveryOEM.

segment.source: ResetConfig.xml:
segment.target: ResetConfig.xml:

segment.source: EnableCustomizationsAfterRecovery.cmd:
segment.target: EnableCustomizationsAfterRecovery.cmd:

segment.source: For multilingual deployments, OOBE.xml uses a more complicated folder structure.
segment.target: For multilingual deployments, OOBE.xml uses a more complicated folder structure.

segment.source: It's OK to just copy the entire folder into C:RecoveryOEM, and then modify the script to copy the entire folder:
segment.target: It's OK to just copy the entire folder into C:RecoveryOEM, and then modify the script to copy the entire folder:

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: Now that you have customized the push-button reset experience, you can deploy the recovery image for push-button reset (Install.wim) to the recovery image partition.
segment.target: Now that you have customized the push-button reset experience, you can deploy the recovery image for push-button reset (Install.wim) to the recovery image partition.

segment.source: To copy the Diskpart script, the ResetConfig.xml file, and the push-button reset recovery image (install.wim) to the recovery image partition of the destination PC, follow the instructions in the Deploy Push-Button Reset Features topic.
segment.target: To copy the Diskpart script, the ResetConfig.xml file, and the push-button reset recovery image (install.wim) to the recovery image partition of the destination PC, follow the instructions in the Deploy Push-Button Reset Features topic.
